entry.title: Combined summary - Sentinel Chains: A Novel Two-Way Peg
entry.summary: The email conversation discusses the concept of Sentinel chains and their potential implementation in the Bitcoin protocol. The main idea behind Sentinel chains is to establish a two-way peg without relying on multisig federations or requiring miners and full nodes to have knowledge about or run a sidechain node.In the proposed solution, sidechain withdrawals are conducted directly through miners. To prevent theft, a three-month period for peg-outs is mandated, during which all miners vote on the peg-out. This allows the community to respond in case of incorrect peg-outs or theft, as miners are expected to make the correct decisions under community pressure. Withdrawals are grouped into large bundles per three-month period to streamline the process of social consensus.The sender believes that this approach, outlined in BIP-300, is a viable and likely effective solution because Bitcoin's mechanism is rooted in social consensus. However, they also introduce the concept of Sentinel chains as an improvement to the current system. Sentinel chains involve sidechain nodes functioning as Sentinels, actively monitoring Bitcoin blocks and transactions for invalid peg-outs that go against sidechain consensus rules. These Sentinels transmit information about these invalid transactions or blocks to public Nostr servers.Bitcoin full nodes interested in participating in sidechain consensus can run a small daemon alongside Bitcoin Core, monitoring Nostr nodes for messages about invalid transactions and instructing Bitcoin Core not to forward those transactions. Each full node can choose its own trusted group of individuals or organizations to receive updates from Nostr, forming a decentralized web of trust.By reversing the conventional model of two-way pegged sidechains, Sentinel chains allow for instantaneous and individual withdrawals without the need for a three-month gradual social consensus. They require an initial consensus soft fork but differ from drivechains in that they enable Bitcoin full nodes to engage in consensus and do not exclude them from participation.Sentinel chains offer advantages in terms of speed and efficiency of consensus. They align more closely with Bitcoin's principles by keeping power within the realm of full nodes. They also protect Core-only users from potential bugs resulting from consensus changes directly implemented in Bitcoin Core.Overall, Sentinel chains provide a promising solution for establishing two-way pegs in the Bitcoin protocol, offering improved efficiency and alignment with Bitcoin's principles.
